channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Wed, 06 Nov 2024 07:30:21 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Economy, Democracy, Abortion: Key issues for American voters as contest between Trump, Harris remain razor-thin
item.description: Early exit polls reveal that the state of democracy is the top concern for most voters in the US presidential election. Abortion and the economy are also key issues. The race between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump remains tight, with voter sentiment reflecting a mix of pessimism and optimism about the country's direction.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: As Americans vote, it's guns out in America
item.description: With a deeply divided America bracing for the presidential election results, concerns are rising about the potential for political violence. The US already witnessed a surge in such incidents this year, fueled by misinformation and access to firearms. Experts warn of armed groups and online platforms promoting violence, raising alarms about the state of American democracy.

item.title: US election results highlights: It's Donald Trump vs Kamala Harris
item.description: Former President Donald Trump and vice president Kamala Harris faced off in a pivotal election that drew millions of voters. Trump secured early victories in Indiana and Kentucky, while Harris claimed Vermont. With polls closing in key states like Georgia, the nation awaits the outcome of this closely watched race.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Philadelphia police say they don't know what 'massive cheating' Trump is talking about
item.description: ​The Philadelphia Police Department told CNN that they were not aware of what Donald Trump referred to in his post as massive cheating and they did not know of any issue regarding the voting that required a law enforcement response. ​"There is absolutely no truth to this allegation. It is yet another example of disinformation. Voting in Philadelphia has been safe and secure," Philadelphia City Commissioner Seth Bluestein posted on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Google clarifies why it's showing 'where to vote for Harris' after Elon Musk flags issue
item.description: "The 'where to vote' panel is triggering for some specific searches [because] Harris is also the name of a county in [Texas]," Google said in a statement. "Fix is coming," the search giant said, adding: "Note very few people actually search for voting places this way." Elon Musk responded to the clarification.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris wins Guam straw poll with 49%. This territory is always right in...
item.description: Guam is a US island territory in Micronesia in the Western Pacific and not a state and hence it is not eligible to elect members of the Electoral College. Its straw poll results, which have been held every four years since 1980, are non-binding and don't count towards the Electoral College.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump to spend election 2024 night with Elon Musk; Kamala Harris to be at Howard University
item.description: Former President Donald Trump will spend election night at Mar-a-Lago with a select group of donors, including Elon Musk. The evening will feature multiple gatherings, culminating in an address at the Palm Beach Convention Center. Meanwhile, Vice President Kamala Harris will attend a watch party at her alma mater, Howard University, after a family dinner.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says Oprah should be ashamed: 'It's ridiculous...she's a divider'
item.description: “I think Oprah’s become a major divider in our country and I think frankly she should be ashamed of herself,” he continued. “And you know who else should be ashamed? Fox. Because I’ve seen Oprah on Fox about 50 times making the same statement. And I think it’s a disgrace what Fox does ’cause everyone thinks Fox is so pro-Trump. They’re not pro-Trump at all. They’ve put Oprah on all morning long," Trump said after his vote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Fake Melania' theory is back as social media users can't believe...
item.description: ​The 'fake Melania' theory made a comeback on social media as users commented that the Melania Trump who came to cast the vote along with Donald Trump was not the real one. This conspiracy theory is not new as it was earlier claimed that sometimes Melania Trump's body double was used at some events. But there was never any evidence in support of that and it remains a social media entertainment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Where is Barron Trump as Donald and Melania cast their votes in Florida?
item.description: Barron Trump, who recently turned 18, was not seen with his parents, Donald and Melania Trump, as they cast their ballots in Florida. While this election marked Barron's first opportunity to vote, it remains unconfirmed if he voted early. Donald Trump expressed confidence in his campaign, highlighting it as potentially his best yet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump impersonator reveals liberal supporter tried to strangle him in hotel elevator
item.description: John Di Domenico, a renowned Donald Trump impersonator, faces growing safety concerns amidst heightened political tensions. Friends and colleagues urge him to wear bulletproof vests during performances, fearing potential threats. The impersonator, who previously enjoyed a diverse repertoire, now primarily receives bookings for his Trump act.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Voting problems reported in Pennsylvania's Cambria, Bedford counties
item.description: Pennsylvania's Cambria and Bedford counties faced scanning problems with the voting machines and software after the voting process began Tuesday. According to reports, the voters could not scan their ballots at Cambria County following which a court order extended the voting time to 10pm, two hours past the 8pm deadline. As Cambria Country is a red zone, MAGA supporters started crying foul on social media and urged the voters to stay up on the line and not to allow any kind of cheating.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 2024 US election: Four scenarios that could define the outcome
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Nate Silver's polls so unreliable...': US election 'Nostradamus' Allan Lichtman's last-minute jibe
item.description: Poll Guru Nate Silver recently accused pollsters of not revealing the actual numbers and intentionally showing a close race. But his final prediction stunned him as he concluded that the chances between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are closer than a coin flip. US election Nostradamus Allan Lichtman took a jibe at Silver as his model now depends on luck.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Do Meghan Markle, Prince Harry vote in US election? Here is what we know
item.description: Meghan Markle is a US citizen but Prince Harry has not yet got US citizenship despite living in California for the last four years because of the row over his visa issue. Prince Harry in his memoir 'Spare' revealed that he took drugs which should have disqualified him for a US visa but he got one. And that started the row which is yet to be resolved. But Harry and Meghan had had rough trysts with the US election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ivanka skips father's 'Women for Trump' rally on election eve, posts this on social media instead
item.description: Donald Trump's 'Women for Trump' rally on the eve of election day was neither attended by Melania nor Ivanka Trump. From his family, the two women on the stage were his other daughter Tiffany and his daughter-in-law Lara Trump. Ivanka Trump who was a part of the former Trump administration announced her exit from politics but did not even post anything for father's re-election bid.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: British Queen Camilla cancels events this week due to chest infection
item.description: Queen Camilla has postponed her engagements this week due to a chest infection, as confirmed by Buckingham Palace. Her doctors have advised rest, leading to her withdrawal from events like the Field of Remembrance opening ceremony. The Duchess of Gloucester will replace her at the ceremony. Camilla hopes to recover before the weekend's Remembrance events.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Home Depot co-founder, GOP donor Megadonor Bernard Marcus passes away
item.description: Home Depot co-founder and prominent GOP donor, Bernard Marcus, has died at 95. Known for his philanthropy, Marcus and his wife pledged a majority of their wealth to charitable causes. He was a staunch supporter of conservative politics, contributing significantly to figures like Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Sunita Williams to cast her vote from space, here is how
item.description: NASA astronaut Sunita Williams is poised to make history by casting her vote in the upcoming US presidential election from the International Space Station (ISS), approximately 400 km above Earth. Following a process similar to absentee voting, Williams will submit her ballot electronically via NASA's secure communication network.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Equatorial Guinea official under investigation after over 400 explicit videos found on his computer
item.description: Baltasar Ebang Engonga, Equatorial Guinea's top financial investigator, is embroiled in a scandal after explicit videos surfaced online, allegedly showing him in compromising situations with various women, including relatives of high-ranking officials. The discovery, made during a fraud investigation into Engonga, has sparked public outrage and prompted investigations into potential health risks and privacy breaches.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
